definition: to open up land for cultivation/to garrison troops to open up land

sentences.english: For this reason, the researches on opening up wasteland were always hot.
sentences.chinese: 爲此，有關屯墾的研究歷來較爲活躍。

sentences.english: The corps' workers are direct cartier of safeguarding the borders.
sentences.chinese: 兵團職工是屯墾戍邊的直接載體。

sentences.english: Part five is the Xinjiang Corps settlement cultural characteristics and functions.
sentences.chinese: 第五部分，新疆兵團屯墾文化的特點和作用。

sentences.english: The corps' workers are direct carrier of safeguarding the borders.
sentences.chinese: 兵團職工是屯墾戍邊的直接載體。

sentences.english: Finally, it explores the Qing policy of governing Mongolia from the pasture and cultivation.
sentences.chinese: 最後從牧廠屯墾來看清代治理蒙古的政策。

sentences.english: Military reclamation carries significant meaning to maintain Xinjiang's stability and security of borders.
sentences.chinese: 屯墾對於維護新疆穩定和邊疆安全具有重要意義。

definition: Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227
Xianyou county in Putian 莆田[Pu2 tian2], Fujian
Binyang county in Nanning 南寧|南宁[Nan2 ning2], Guangxi
the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
